snippet: Colleges and universities have become more aggressive about punishing alcohol and drug offenses, even as the rate of serious crime on campus has dropped, according to a government report.
abstract: Report from Education and Justice Departments finds that colleges are more aggressive about punishing alcohol and drug offenses, even as rate of serious crime on campuses has dropped; specialists on campus safety caution crime figures should not be taken at face value, because much of decline resulted from new Education Dept guidelines on how to define most common of the serious crimes, burglary; victim advocates say many institutions are sloppy or intentionally misleading when reporting crime data.
lead_paragraph: Colleges and universities have become more aggressive about punishing alcohol and drug offenses, even as the rate of serious crime on campus has dropped, according to a government report.

headline.main: Colleges Focus on Alcohol and Drugs as Serious Crime Dips
headline.print_headline: Colleges Focus on Alcohol and Drugs as Crime Dips
